1 fascicle
Composed by Bodhisattva Asaá¹…ga
It should be known that the supreme benefit is for the body and its dependents,
Obtaining what has not been obtained and not regressing, which is called the supreme entrustment.
The mind is vast and supreme, reaching the utmost without error,
The abode of the intention to benefit, the merit of this vehicle is complete.
The six pÄramitÄs are all called giving, by means of wealth, fearlessness, and the Dharma,
Among them, the first, second, and third are called the practice of non-abiding.
For one's own body, repaying kindness, and karmic retribution, all are not attached,
In order to depart from the unarisen, and to depart from other practices.
Subsuming and subduing are in the three wheels, eliminating the mind of characteristics,
Later doubts are all eliminated as they arise.
If one takes it to be the accumulation of creation, the wonderful characteristics are not the supreme characteristics,
Because the three characteristics change, there is no such thing as the TathÄgata.
The cause and effect are profound, spoken in that evil time,
This is not without benefit, due to the three bodhisattvas' distinctions.
Because in the past Buddhas' places, they upheld the precepts and learning,
And planted good roots, therefore they are called those with precepts and virtues.
Because they can sever the thought of self and the thought of dharmas,
This is called having wisdom. The two sets of four distinctions make eight.
The separate substance continues to arise, abiding until the end of life,
Again seeking other destinies, the thought of self has four kinds.
Because they do not exist, they cannot be said to exist,
Because they are the causes of verbal expression, the thought of dharmas has four kinds.
Due to the power of their faith and understanding, they give rise to the thought of reality out of faith,
Because they do not grasp according to the words, and because they grasp the correct teachings.
The Buddha understands the result is not comparable, by means of the knowledge of vows he knows,
For those seeking profit and respect, he prohibits them from speaking of themselves.
Realization does not abide in dharmas, for the sake of this accord,
Just like abandoning the raft, this is the hidden meaning that should be known.
The transformed body is not the true Buddha, nor is it the one who expounds the Dharma,
Expounding the Dharma is neither of the two grasps, what is expounded is apart from verbal expression.
Receiving it oneself and speaking for others, is not without benefit, accumulating merit,
Merit does not uphold enlightenment, because those two are able to uphold it.
Obtaining the cause of self-nature, the rest of this is arising,
Only because it is the Dharma of the Buddha, it is able to accomplish the most excellent merit.
Because it does not grasp its own result, it is not graspable or expressible,
Because it is liberated from the two obstructions, it is said to be wonderfully born and free from contention.
In the presence of Buddha DÄ«paá¹ƒkara, it is said that the Dharma of realization is not grasped,
Therefore, the realized Dharma is not what is grasped or spoken.
The stream of consciousness is the nature of consciousness only, and the pure land is not what is grasped.
Because it is formless and supreme, it is not accepted as the nature of adornment.
It is like the wondrous Mount Sumeru, which is not grasped in enjoyment.
Because it is not of the nature of the contaminated, it is also not created by causes.
In order to show the many distinctions and achieve supremacy,
The merits of the past and present are not the same, and other analogies are presented.
Because both achieve respect, by the supremacy of the natural outflow,
Because of the nature of the cause of afflictions, by the inferior and also the supreme.
Because the result is supreme suffering, because the supreme event is difficult to encounter,
Because the shore of the object is not known, because it is not shared with others.
Because it is the nature of the profound, because it surpasses other brief explanations,
Because the clan is lofty and supreme, the merit is superior to the merit of hope.
When practicing patience, although it is difficult, it is good,
and because those virtues are difficult to measure, they are called excellent deeds.
Because there is no angry mind, it is not called the nature of suffering,
and because there is great compassion and joy, practicing is not the result of suffering.
The mind of seeking should be firm,
because it is the cause of attaining patience and the expedient means of this mind.
One should know that the correct practitioner is the cause of benefiting beings,
and one should know that the characteristics of sentient beings should be completely eliminated.
Those characteristics are called the accumulation of names, and the supreme one eliminates their thoughts,
and the World-Honored Ones are incomparable, because they are associated with true insight.ğŸ”½The result does not abide in the stage of the cause,
and this is the cause of attaining that result.
Because the World-Honored One speaks the truth, there should be known to be four kinds.ğŸ”½Making a vow to speak of the lower vehicle,
and speaking of the meaning of the Great Vehicle,
Because all the predictions are without distinction.
Because one does not attain it, it is neither real nor false,
For the sake of those who grasp it as it is said, it is proclaimed.
At all times and in all places, one does not attain true reality,
Because of ignorance there is abiding, by wisdom without abiding one attains truth.
Ignorance is like darkness, one should understand wisdom as light,
Because the able and the counteracted, gain and loss are present.
By such correct practice, one attains such an amount of merit,
For the one who practices the Dharma correctly, the function will now be explained.
Among people there are three kinds, upholding, hearing, and extensive explanation,
The meaning is attained from others, and by what one has heard and contemplated.
This is said to be mature within oneself, the rest accomplishes other sentient beings,
By the nature of matter, time, and greatness, in terms of merit, merit is superior.
The nature of non-objects and the unique nature, the able reliance is the great person,
And difficult to hear, the unsurpassed cause increases.
If one merely upholds the true Dharma, the basis becomes a vessel,
Eliminating all karmic hindrances, one quickly attains the nature of spiritual powers.
The worldly wonderful affairs are perfect, the ripening is extremely noble,
Cultivating this Dharma, one should know one attains this karma.
When one practices with one's own body, taking oneself as a bodhisattva,
It is called a hindrance to the mind, contradicting the mind of non-abiding.
Because of granting predictions for later times, the practice of lighting lamps is not supreme,
The bodhisattvas' practice is the same, not really created by causes.
Because the characteristics of non-existence are the characteristics, therefore it is shown to be not false,
Because the Dharma is the Buddha's Dharma, all are not the characteristics of conditioned phenomena.
It is said that the Dharma body Buddha, should be known as the analogy for the hero,
The body that is unobstructed and perfect, is the nature of universal pervasion,
And because it is the essence of virtue and greatness, it is also called the great body.
The existence of what is not existent is said to be non-existence.
Not understanding the Dharma realm, giving rise to the thought of liberating sentient beings,
And purifying the buddha-land, this is called deception and falsehood.
In the assembly of bodhisattvas, all dharmas are without self-nature.
If one understands this, although not yet a sage, it is called the wisdom of a sage.
Although one does not see dharmas, this is not the absence of the eye.
The Buddha is able to possess five kinds, because the objects are false.
The various mental states flow and turn, departing from the abode of mindfulness.
They are without support, always turning, therefore they are said to be false.
One should know that this is supported by wisdom, and then it is not false.
In order to manifest the cause of this merit, the metaphor is stated again.
It means that in the true Dharma body, there is no perfection of minor marks,
And it is also not endowed with characteristics, and its nature should be known as non-body.
In the Dharma body there is no distinction, and it is not that the TathÄgata is non-dual,
The repeated statement of its endowment with characteristics is because both natures are non-existent.
As the Buddha said, it is also non-existent, and the two are what is grasped,
Because it is not apart from the Dharma realm, the statement is also without self-nature.ğŸ”½Although the one who speaks and what is spoken are very profound,
There are still those who have faith and respect,
Because it is neither sentient beings nor non-sentient beings, and it is in accord with the characteristics of the holy ones.
Because there is no dharma whatsoever, the unsurpassed enlightenment should be known,
Because the Dharma realm does not increase, and its pure equality nature,
And the unsurpassed skillful means, because its contaminated nature is not a dharma,
Therefore it is not a wholesome dharma, and because of this it is called wholesome.
Although the teaching is indeterminate, it is not that it cannot be known,
Therefore, this one Dharma treasure surpasses those immeasurable treasures.
In all calculations and analogies, there are also differences in causes,
The investigation of the world cannot reach it with metaphors.
Because the Dharma realm is equal, the Buddha does not liberate sentient beings,
In all the collections of names, it is not outside the Dharma realm.
If one gives rise to the grasping of dharmas, it is the same as the fault of grasping a self,
Certainly grasping the liberation of sentient beings is grasping the false grasping.
One should not take the essence of form to be only the Dharma body of the TathÄgata,
Do not let that wheel-turning king be equal to the TathÄgata.
The complete marks and retribution are not allowed to be fully meritorious,
Able to attract the Dharma body, due to the difference in skillful means.
Only seeing form and hearing sound, this person does not know the Buddha,
This true suchness dharma body is not the realm of consciousness.
That merit is not lost, and the fruits of retribution are not cut off,
Attaining forbearance is also not cut off, because one obtains the unstained.
Again discussing the cause of merit, for this reason it is presented as an analogy,
Because that merit has no retribution, it is correctly taken but not taken in excess.
That merit attracts the fruit of transformation, and performs the affairs of benefiting sentient beings,
Those affairs are due to spontaneous activity, and upon becoming a buddha, manifest in all directions.
The past, future, and so forth are transformations, while the correct enlightenment is always unmoving,
One should know that it is neither the same nor different in the realm of dharmas.
Using dust to make ink, it is used as an analogy to illustrate the dharma realm,
This treatise on making ink is to show the exhaustion of afflictions.
Neither an aggregate nor a collection nature, it shows that it is not a single nature,
In that total collection nature, it clarifies that it is not a different nature.
Not understanding that it is mere conventional speech, foolish ordinary beings falsely grasp at
The cessation of the two kinds of self and dharmas, because there is no realization of non-existence.
Therefore, the view of non-existence is a view, a false grasping at a nonexistent object,
This is a subtle obstacle, which is eliminated by knowing it in this way.
By attaining the two kinds of knowledge and concentration, it is then removed,
Chen Fu clearly states that the transformation body is not without inexhaustible blessings.
When the buddhas expound the Dharma, they do not say that the body is a transformation,
Because they do not say it themselves, it is their true teaching.
The realization of the TathÄgata's nirvÄá¹‡a is neither created nor different,
This compilation has nine creations, due to the correct wisdom observation.
The seen, the characteristics, and consciousness, the abode, the body, and enjoyment,
The past, the present, and the future, are thoroughly observed.
Due to the observation of characteristics, enjoyment and transformation,
One attains stainless mastery.
Verses on the Vajra Prajnaparamita Sutra
